oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A taxonomic revision helps to clarify differences between the Atlantic invasive Ptilohyale littoralis and the Mediterranean endemic Parhyale plumicornis (Crustacea, Amphipoda)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lo Brutto, Sabrina
Iaciofano, Davide
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p><jats:italic>Ptilohyaleexplorator</jats:italic> (formerly <jats:italic>Parhyaleexplorator</jats:italic>), described by Arresti (1989), can be considered to be a synonym of west-Atlantic <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic> (Stimpson, 1853), based on morphological observations of paratypes and specimens recently collected in the type locality of <jats:italic>Ptilohyaleexplorator</jats:italic>. The first collections of <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic>, from the eastern Atlantic were from the port of Rotterdam (The Netherlands) in 2009 and later in Wimereux, Opal Coast (France) in 2014; however, the synonymy of <jats:italic>Ptilohyaleexplorator</jats:italic> with <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic> backdates to the first European record of <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic> in 1985 at La Vigne, Bay of Arcachon (France). This indicates that <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic> has been established along European Atlantic coast for many years.</jats:p> <jats:p>An assessment of the nominal valid species belonging to the genus <jats:italic>Ptilohyale</jats:italic> was carried out and a comparison between the Atlantic <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic> and the very similar Mediterranean hyalid species, <jats:italic>Parhyaleplumicornis</jats:italic>, is presented based on morphological features and distribution. Due to the invasive ability of <jats:italic>Ptilohyalelittoralis</jats:italic>, a comparison between the two species is necessary.</jats:p>
